Test Description:
TC: Login should fail when non secure auth-server is disabled
Steps:-
Create non secure Auth-Server without enable flag
Create local group which is mapped to remote group
Try login using remote user which is already configured in remote group, it should fail
Enable auth server
Login using remote user should work 
Login as admin, Delete group, auth-server
Notes / Detailed Description:
To create,delete auth-server, group, user
Please check user doc or dctl help

Test Description:
TC: Login should fail when secure auth-server is disabled
Steps:-
Create secure Auth-Server without enable flag
Create local group which is mapped to remote group
Try login using remote user which is already configured in remote group, it should fail
Enable auth server
Login using remote user should work 
Login as admin, Delete group, auth-server

TC: User login should fail for non existing auth-server
Steps:
Create local group which is mapped to remote group (non existing ldap)
User login should fail

TC: User login should fail after connection loss to auth-server
Steps:-
Create non-secure/secure Auth-Server with Enable flag
Create local group which is mapped to remote group
Login using remote user which is already configured in remote group
Disconnect ldap (make ip unrechable or delete auth-server)
Logout
Login using remote user it should fail
Login as admin, Delete group, auth-server

TC: Static endpoint created by userX can be used by another user
Steps:-
Create non-secure/secure Auth-Server with Enable flag
Create local group groupX with role network-edit, which is mapped to remote group1
Login as userX, which is already configured in remote group groupX
Create static endpoint epY in namespace nsY
Create local group groupY with role container-edit/nsY, which is mapped to remote group2
Login as userY, which is already configured in remote group group2
Create pod uisng static endpoint epY
Pod should go into running state
Validate Pod should be using epY
Delete Pod
Login as userX
Delete epY
Login as admin and delete  groups, auth-server

TC: User, Group creation by non admin user and Resource created by one user can be listed by other user
Steps:-
Create non-secure/secure Auth-Server with Enable flag
Create local group groupA with role user-edit
Create remote user userA under groupA
Login as userA
Create local group  groupB with role volume-edit,volumeclaim-edit, which is remotely mapped to group1
Create local groupC with volume-view
Create remote user userC under groupC
Login as userB, which is already configured in remote group groupB
Create some volumes [static/dynamic(static pvc, dynamic pvc)]
Login as userC
userC should able to list all volumes which is created by userB
Login as userB delete volumes
Login as userA
Delete userC
Delete groupB, groupC
Login as admin, delete GroupA, auth-server

TC: Auth-server, User, Group creation by non admin user and perform operation using newly created user, group  from new auth-server
Steps:-
Create non-secure/secure Auth-Server with Enable flag
Create local group groupA with role user-edit, which is remotely mapped to group1
Login as userA (which is under group group1)
Create another non-secure/secure Auth-Server  auth-serverX with Enable flag
Create local group groupB with any role, which is remotely mapped to groupX1 under auth-serverX
Login as userB, which is already configured in remote group groupX1
Perform operatoin(list, create, delete, get) according to role
Login as userA
Delete groupB, auth-serverX
Login as admin
Delete groupA, Auth-server

Scenario / Category: Multiple Remote Group with single Remote user
Test Description:
TC: Remote user belongs to different groups should get permission of all the groups
Steps:-
Create non-secure/secure Auth-Server with Enable flag
Create local group groupA,B,C with different role, which is remotely mapped to group1,2,3
Login as remote user which is present in all above groups group1,2,3
Login should be successful and user should get all permission of groupA,B,C
Login as admin
Delete groupA,B,C and auth-server
Expected Behaviour:
Tested with 2 groups
as ldap is configured with 2 grps only

Scenario / Category: Multiple Remote user with single Remote Group
Test Description:
TC: Multiple remote user with single remote Group, All users should get same permission
Steps:-
Create non-secure/secure Auth-Server with Enable flag
Create local group groupA with any(e.g. user-view) role, which is remotely mapped to group1
Login remote usersA which is under the group group1
userA should should have user-view previllages 
Login remote usersB which is under the group group1
userA should should have user-view previllages 
Login remote usersC which is under the group group1
userA should should have user-view previllages 
Login remote usersD which is under the group group1
userA should should have user-view previllages 
Login remote usersE which is under the group group1
userA should should have user-view previllages 
Login as admin
Delete groupA, auth-server

TC: Multiple auth-servers, groups for limit test
Steps:-
Create multiple non-secure/secure Auth-Servers with Enable flag (auth-servers with different domain, subdomain)
Create 64 local groups with any role, which are remotely mapped to 64 remote group
Login as 64 users, which are already configured in 64 remote groups
Login as admin
Delete groups and auth-servers
Expected Behaviour:
Tested with 9 groups only
Becase we have ldap with 9 groups under 2 AD's

Test Description:
TC: Multiple auth-servers for limit test
Steps:-
Create maximum supported non-secure/secure Auth-Servers with Enable flag (auth-servers with different domain, subdomain)
Login as admin
Delete auth-servers
Expected Behaviour:
Tested with 4 auth-servers only
Because we have only 4 auth-servers

Test Description:
TC: Login using short, long name with remote group
Steps:-
Create non-secure/secure Auth-Servers with Enable flag
Create local group groupA with role network-view, which remotely mapped to group1
Login using short name as remote usersA which is under the remote group group1 - it should work
Login using long name as remote usersA@abc.com which is under the remote group group1 - it should work

TC: Login using short, long name with local group
Steps:-
Create non-secure/secure Auth-Servers with Enable flag
Create local group with perftier-edit role
Create remote user without domain( e.g aduser3)
Create remote user with domain(e.g aduser4@example.com)
Login as user (aduser3) without domain - should work
Login as user (aduser4@example.com) with domain - should work

Scenario / Category: Domain with more than one auth-server
Test Description:
TC: Multilpe auth-server (with different doamin) user login with short name should fail
Steps:-
Create auth-server with domain abc.dom
Create auth-server with domain xyz.dom
Create local group with perftier-edit role, which is remotely mapped to group group1 under abc.com
Create local group with perftier-edit role, which is remotely mapped to group group1 under xyz.com
Login as user (from group1 under abc.com) with-domain/full-name - should work
Login as user (from group1 under abc.com) without-domain/short-name- should should fail
Login as user (from group1 under xyz.com) with-domain/full-name - should work
Login as user (from group1 under xyz.com) without-domain/short-name- should should fail

TC: User mapped to two different domain group
Steps:-
Create auth-server with domain dev.adexample.com
Create local group mapped to remote group aduniversal1 on the other domain (adexample.com)
Try login with aduser104@dev.adexample.com - it should let user in
Notes / Detailed Description:
dctl user auth-server create test3 -S 35.162.251.145 --port 389 --base-dn 'DC=dev,DC=adexample,DC=com' --bind-dn 'CN=Admin,CN=Users,DC=dev,DC=adexample,DC=com' --bind-password 'Diamanti@111' --user-filter '(sAMAccountName=%s)' --enable
dctl user group create universal --role-list network-view,container-edit/universal --external-group aduniversal1@adexample.com
dctl login -u aduser104@dev.adexample.com -p 111Market

Test Description:
TC: user login should fail for non existing remote group,user
Steps:-
Create auth-server 
Create non exist remote group groupA with role node-view
Create remote user userA under groupA
Login as userA, it should fail bcz remote group,user does not exist

Create auth-server
Create remote group with invalid domain
Create local user with remote auth 
Login as user
It should not able to access cluster details because domain is invalid
Automation TC Name:
This TC can be removed 
user is able to login
It's act as creation of remote user and login 
Remote group is not playing role gere
Expected Behaviour: User able to access cluster and does the operation

Test Description:
TC: After deleting auth-server user login should fail
Steps:-
Create auth-server
Create local group groupA with role user-edit, which is remotely mapped to group group1
Login as user userA, which is already configured in remote group group1
Create another auth-serverX
Create local group groupB whith any role, which is remotely mapped to group group2 under auth-serverX
Login as userB, which is already configured in remote group group2
Login as userA
Delete auth-serverX
Try login as userB it should fail
Delete  groupB
Login as admin delete auth-server

TC: user operation should fail for remote group name having special character (except allowed chars)
Steps:-
Create auth-server
Create local group groupA with role perftier-edit, which is remotely mapped to group group1 having special charaters in group name (except allowed charaters)
Try to login with user under remote group
User should be able to login, but should not allow to perform any action.

TC: user operation should fail for remote group name having special character (except allowed chars) and user operation should allowed for normal group
Steps:-
Create auth-server
Create local group groupA which volume-edit role, which is remotely mapped to group group1 having special charaters in group name (except allowed charaters)
Create local group groupB with perftier-edit role, which is remotely mapped to group group2 
Try to login with user under remote group group1 and group2 (both remote group should have one user common)
User should be able to login, but should have access get role specified for GroupB only.
